fields.description:
Please add a feature to confluence which lists all the  links to external content added to particular page/space. 
In addition to this, it would be useful to validate if external link are accessible by confluence
fields.summary: Add option to validate external links added to confluence page/space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tinyurl links are not displayed in page information -> incoming links menu

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create three pages: page1, page2, page3
 # Navigate to page1 -> "..." -> page information. Copy tinyurl link 
 # Go to page2. Enter edit mode and add tinyurl link from previous step 
 # Navigate to page3 and copy complete page url (not tinyurl link)
 # Go to page2. Enter edit mode and add  page link from previous step corresponding to page3 
 # Go to page1 -> "..." -> page information. Check incoming links section
 # Go to page3 -> "..." -> page information. Check incoming links section
 
h3. Expected Results
Page1 and page3 contain incoming links from page2 

h3. Actual Results
Page1 doesn't contain incoming link from page2 (copied as tinyurl link)

h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tinyurl links are not displayed in page information -> incoming links menu

fields.description: Disable TLS 1.0, TLS 1.1 on the AWS load balancer. The CloudFormation templates enable TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 even though these are no longer considered secure. Please disable these by default or allow us to specify our own TLS options and ciphers.
fields.summary: Disable TLS 1.0,1.1 by default while deploying Confluence on AWS through quickstart template

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When we publish the page which contains table, the table formatting breaks. 
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.10.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step-1. Create a table on a page (ex 3*3).
 Step-2. Fill cells with some data. As it shown in attached "image-2021-02-04-11-48-06-963.png" and save the page. Everything looks fine so far   
{quote}!image-2021-02-04-11-48-06-963.png|width=288,height=228!
{quote}
Step-3. Edit the page again and *merge* the Heading1 with other rows using merge cells button.
{quote}!image-2021-02-04-11-52-20-013.png|width=351,height=216!
{quote}
Step-4. Click to button save and it will lose the table formatting as below: 
{quote}!image-2021-02-04-11-54-44-312.png|width=282,height=233!
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

_It should not lose the formatting of table and show 3*3 table as follows:_

!image-2021-02-04-11-52-20-013.png|width=351,height=216!
h3. Actual Results

_Table formatting breaks._ 
h3. Workaround
 #  Install [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/versionhistory] plugin. 
 # After installing, please navigate to the problematic page. 
 # Edit the page and click the source code *<>* in the right top.
 # search for <tbody> and </tbody> tags and replace with <thead> and </thead> tags.
 # Click on Apply and save the page.  

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Confluence tables format breaks when header merged with rows.

fields.description: Would like to have a Jira board and calendar on the same confluence page.
fields.summary: Add ability to have calendar part of a dashboard

fields.description: I need to be able to have a larger vertical viewing ability
fields.summary: Increase vertical scaling

fields.description: In addition to the already existing function to send an email reminder, would like the ability to send a reminder for an event to a SLACK channel.
fields.summary: Add ability to send reminder to SLACK

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Loading resources in the Bundled Confluence Mobile app causes resources to be loaded twice

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create an app that requires resources for mobile apps using:
{code}
#if($mobile)
    #requireResource("some-key:mobile-dialog-resources")
#end
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Each resource is loaded only once

h3. Actual Results
Resources are loaded twice, which means handlers are duplicated and events fire twice for each one of these.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading resources in the Bundled Confluence Mobile app causes resources to be loaded twice

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Blog post macro doesn't display date without Excerpt macro
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Create a blogpost with date
 * Create a test page
 * Insert blog post macro
 * Choose 'Content type to display' as 'excerpts'
 * Click 'preview'

h3. Expected Behaviour

The macro should display the content with date
h3. Actual Behaviour

The macro display the content without the date.
h3. Workaround

Date gets displayed only if the content on the blog-post added within an Excerpt macro.
fields.summary: Blog post macro doesn't display date without Excerpt macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PDF export of a page with special characters, such as circular brackets () in its title, break exported PDF's filename
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence with a file name having circular brackets () in its title eg. My (test)
 # Export the page as PDF

h3. Expected Results

Page export should have a name as "e1611236209640-My (test)-030221-1307-15.pdf"
h3. Actual Results

Page export has a random name "e1611236209640-4161557-030221-1306-13.pdf"

!Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 1.12.29 PM.png|width=594,height=197!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF export of a page with special characters () in its title break exported PDF's filename

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Extreme calendar timezone changes may cause rescheduled recurrence events to revert to original event

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar in +11 timezone
 # Create a recurrence series of non-allday events
 # Edit a couple of the events to allday for example. Try moving some events to different dates and times.
 # Change calendar timezone to +14

h3. Expected Results
Changes persist even after timezone changes

h3. Actual Results
Some of the rescheduled event data will be lost. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Extreme calendar timezone changes may cause rescheduled recurrence events to revert to original event

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using CalDAV client and rescheduling individual recurrence event in and switching allday<->non allday shows duplicate events in CalDAV client

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a recurrence series in Team Calendars
 # Subscribe to the calendar using CalDAV in Thunderbird
 # Edit one of the events individually and switch it between allday<->non allday

h3. Expected Results
Both the original event and the rescheduled event will show in the CalDAV client

h3. Actual Results
Only the rescheduled event should show. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using CalDAV client and rescheduling individual recurrence event in and switching allday<->non allday shows duplicate events in CalDAV client

fields.description:
We have a complex template consisting of several pages organized in a tree. We use this template by copying the root page with all its subpages.

We also use the task widget and the task report widget.

Unfortunately, when copying a tree of pages, all the internal page references are adapted but not the task report widget.

Thus, the task reports of the copied template refers wrongly to the tasks in the template.

We would really appreciate it, if the page copy would also support the adaption of the task report widget.
fields.summary: Adapting the todo list when copying page trees

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When searching for something on the livesearch it shows all results, including attachments, in no specific order.

The suggestion here is that pages titles should be shown higher on the results list.
h3. Suggested Solution

_Make page titles and page text content higher on the search results lists than attachments. or at least add a way to order the list manually._
h3. Why This Is Important

_Having too many unwanted results might be cumbersome._
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro should prioritise page title results over attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting future events in recurrence series will recur until a day before the deleted event. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a recurring event that has multiple days in a row. Set it to start at 8am-9am. You need to configure the local calendar timezone to +1345 (and user timezone to -10 Hawaii)
 # Select an event that has another event in the series one day before. Delete this event and select to remove all future events. 

h3. Expected Results
Original events go up to and include the day before. 

h3. Actual Results
Event on day before is excluded

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting future events in recurrence series will cut off one day too early

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading to 7.10, with the latest Office libraries, on Linux, Confluence installed by official installer cannot render CJK Office files correctly in File Preview Macro (image) and View File Macro (PDF).

https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install Confluence through bin file on Linux
* Upload a CJK file

h3. Expected Results

The file could be rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results

The character might be garbled or missing or rendered as squares.

h3. Workaround

To install missing font dependencies, you may follow steps outlined by these 4 KB articles:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/the-text-in-a-powerpoint-excel-or-word-document-is-missing-or-looks-different-via-confluence-view-file-macro-200213562.html

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/non-ascii-characters-display-as-square-characters-in-confluence-317948797.html

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/2-byte-characters-japanese-korean-chinese-do-not-display-in-powerpoint-macro-640189539.html

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-ui-shows-garbled-or-corrupt-text-on-captcha-macros-and-or-diagrams-due-to-missing-fonts-938027858.html
fields.summary: File Preview Macro and View File Macro on Linux cannot render CJK characters correctly

fields.description:
Confluence currently have the functionality to list out the Popular pages (most Likes) within the entire Confluence in the Dashboard. 

It will be much helpful to have a feature to customise the list of Popular pages by Space or Parent Page (or a bundled macro) that could help list out only the most liked or most visited pages/content within a Space or Parent Page.
fields.summary: Ability to list the Popular and Most Visited Child Pages in a Parent Page or Space

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the "people who can view" option shows administrator details in the list. This exposes the admin username information and users can attempt to login and cause the login to be locked while using wrong passwords. This could be a security issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
There could be a flag made available to ensure that users under "confluence-administrators" are not listed under this detail so that the feature is available for everyone, but they cannot see administrators listed under this.

h3. Why This Is Important
To ensure unauthorised usage and blocking of admin login.

h3. Workaround
Currently there are no workarounds.
fields.summary: Option to hide "administrator" from "people who can view"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The terminology around the concept of a shared home has become confusing. See this PR [comment|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFSERVER/repos/confluence/pull-requests/11403/overview?commentId=2786227].

Previously it was assumed that the isClustered check was synonymous with a Data Center license. This has changed with the addition of SNDC, which is essentially a Server instance with a Data Center license. 

Further to that, it was also assumed that isClustered would mean that the instance had a Cluster Shared Home configured. Once again this has changed with SNDC.

Currently there are 3 variations of the Home directory:
 # The Local Home directory (used in Server, SNDC and DC)
 # The Shared Local Home directory (used in Server, SNDC and could be used in DC?)
 # The Cluster Shared Home directory (used by DC and possibly SNDC)

It would make it easier if these concepts were easily understood from within the codebase and formed part of an API.
fields.summary: Change the terminology relating to the Cluster Home and fix APIs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As an admin, I'd very much like to create a post-mortem template that would automatically list all the action items created from the page in a useful format. I can see them by clicking the 8 links at the top of the page (attached screenshot), But it's not very useful - just issue number and status. I can cobble some JQL to show them usefully using the Jira issues macro but that's not useful because not all template users will know JQL well enough to handle that. 

What we want is for the Jira issues that are linked in the confluence page to be integrated with confluence using the same methods available when pulling in Jira issues through the Jira issues macro.

When creating Jira issues from the confluence page itself, it can easily be inferred that these issues are very important to the page, yet they are only accessible through an extremely tiny and not very useful or informative link at the top of the page (see attached). There is also no simple way to display them through the Jira issues macro because the link is not accessible via JQL.

The lack of this feature makes Jira and Confluence less integrated than it could be. It would encourage users to create issues from Confluence page by allowing them useful and intuitive ways to track those issues.
fields.summary: List linked Jira issues in useful format

fields.description:

Allow users to configure the Word Document Size for Import

fields.description:
I've succesfully implemented the SSO using OIDC on Keycloak but in the plugin provided by Atlassian tgere is a wrong behaviour when logging out.

The log out button just logs out from the Atlassian application itself, instead it should call an end_session_endpoint like "https://idp.mydomain.ext/auth/realms/myrealm/protocol/openid-connect/logout?redirect_uri=[https://confluence.mydomain.ext/]"

The logout it will then be for all the platform using OIDC to authenticate. The actual behaviour gives the wrong impression you logged out meanwhile the OIDC token remains valid for all other platform using it

 

Regards

Marco Palumbo
fields.summary: Wrong logout behaviour on OIDC provided by SSO for Atlassian Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Confluence shortcut key event handler is (correctly) suppressing keypress events for  HTML input elements.  This prevents the invocation of Confluence shortcuts when typing in an editor.

The Confluence shortcut key event handler is not suppressing keypress events for contenteditable HTML inputs (like a div with contenteditable="true"). This, in turn, causes any plugins/addons using RTE to invoke shortcuts while typing in content.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create any [contentEditable|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement/contentEditable] elements in an app, attempt to type into them and verify the shortcut handler is invoked.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence shortcut keys should not be invoked when typing in an RTE plugin

h3. Actual Results
Confluence shortcut keys ARE invoked when typing in an RTE plugin

h3. Workaround
The workaround is to implement a custom keypress event handler which then pushes changes into the contentEditable element.
fields.summary: Typing in a RTE component invokes the shortcut key handler

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Contributor Summary app doesn't return correct data when using multiple spaces in filters or using "@all" or @global filters
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two spaces with around 400-500 pages
 # On a page add contributor summary macro with SPACE A in the Space filter
 # On the same page add contributor summary macro with SPACE B in the Space filter
 # add another contributor summary macro with SPACE A, SPACE B in the Space filter
 # add another contributor summary macro with @all  in the Space filter

* Leave the rest of the filters as it is
* No page restrictions applied 

h3. Expected Results

Values in the 3rd filter(Space-A, Space B) should match the value taken by adding values in 2nd and third filter
h3. Actual Results
* The value doesn't match
* Value in the third filter is less then what is shown in the filter of individual spaces
* Value using @global or all is also less than the value shown by individual spaces
 
Snapshot of my local testing
 !Screenshot 2021-01-27 at 9.21.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 No workaround currently
fields.summary: Contributor Summary app doesn't return correct data when using multiple spaces in filters or using "@all" or @global filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the indent option in Confluence page editor and then adding a list to the indented text will break the indentation.  Works fine before Confluence 7.x.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Indent the text
# Add a numbered or bullet list

h3. Expected Results
The list is added and remains indented. Further indentation is possible. See video on a working version:
 [^indentworking.mp4] 

h3. Actual Results
The indentation is removed. See video for clarification:
 [^indentnotworking.mp4] 
In Confluence 7.4.x, further indentation is *not* possible. This second problem is *not* replicable in Confluence 7.10. See video for clarification:
 [^nofurtherindentation.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Add the list before indenting the text if possible.
fields.summary: Adding a list to indented text breaks the indentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is randomly logged out on Confluence Mobile (android) due to session timeout
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence server mobile app (or use android emulator)
 # Add some content to Confluence including pages containing image attachments
 # Login to Confluence and navigate to the various pages.

h3. Expected Results
 * User is able to open any pages without any problems

h3. Actual Results

User is randomly logged out when navigating  pages. Following error might be displayed to the user:
 "Session expired. Log in
 again to keep working".
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 h5. Notes:
Local testing performed using:
Confluence 7.4.6, 7.10.2 
Android 9.0
Confluence mobile app 0.9.5
fields.summary: User is  randomly logged out on Confluence Mobile (android) due to session timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when the AD admin create a user account in the LDAP and configure a the account to use a [shared mailbox|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/collaboration/shared-mailboxes/shared-mailboxes?view=exchserver-2019] (feature provided by Microsoft AD), the user account is being synced as inactive. and not able to make the user account to active. 

This is because Microsoft AD use the inactive status of the account to identify if that account is using a shared mailbox.
* [why user associated with a shared mailbox is always a disabled user account|https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/ceb144c0-7cee-487f-a35e-c0301418660f/why-user-associated-with-a-shared-mailbox-is-always-a-disabled-user-account?forum=onlineservicesexchange]

h3. Suggestion
implement the feature in Confluence to allow user account use shared mailbox and make the user status active.
fields.summary: Support user account to use a shared mailbox

fields.description:

fields.description:
The *Pre-upgrade planning tool* is not verifying if the database current version is supported when selecting the Confluence target new version.

Per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/pre-upgrade-planning-tool-973479832.html], the tool will run a health check for the "Supported databases" based on the following:
{quote}Ensures your instance is using a supported database vendor and version.
{quote}
h4. Environment
 * Confluence 6.13.6
 * Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools 1.30.1
 * MSSQL 2014

h4. Test details

1) Install Confluence 6.13.6 with MSSQL 2014 database. (Supported database based on [6.13 supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/supported-platforms-964961686.html]).

2) Upgrade ATST (Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools) plugin to version 1.30.1.

3) Go to administration -> Plan your upgrade and plan the upgrade to version 7.10.2. (Does *not* support MSSQL 2014 per [7.10 supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html]).
h4. Expected results

The pre-upgrade check should warn the users about incompatibilities and unsupported environments (such as the MSSQL 2014) for the target version on this page before the upgrade is attempted.
h4. Actual results

Confluence shows a misleading successful check message which can lead to upgrades using unsupported platforms as we can see in the image below:

!plan_your_upgrade_message.PNG|thumbnail!
h4. Workaround

Upgrade to ATST 1.32.1 via marketplace.

Ensure that you are using the software stated on the [supported platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html] of the Confluence target version before upgrading the application.
fields.summary: Plan your upgrade functionality does not check database version

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a document containing many images are imported into Confluence, every user who has access to that space/page receives one email per image in that document. This creates a spam of several hundred emails being sent to all users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way in the UI to disable mails being sent during document import. Or perhaps, send one mail per document instead of one mail per image within that document.

h3. Why This Is Important

This is important because if a single document contains 50 images etc, and if there are 100 users watching/having access to that space this would mean that 50 X 100 = 5000 emails being sent for a single document, which sometimes swamps the mail server and creates unnecessary spam.

h3. Workaround

Currently we can disable this by enabling the following config to false in the db bandana table for system plugins:

{code}
<entry>
 <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-file-notifications:file-content-update-notification</string>
 <boolean>false</boolean>
 </entry>
 <entry>
 <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-file-notifications:file-content-delete-notification</string>
 <boolean>false</boolean>
 </entry>
{code}
fields.summary: Importing document with many images creates mail storm to users

fields.description:
Currently, only maximum size limit is applied for attachments. The customer want to have a confirmation dialog before uploading to avoid uploading unnecessary contents.
 * Confirmation dialog function can be set by space.
 * Showing confirmation dialog for those file patterns (*.zip , *.ppt, etc.) are specified.  
 * User can specify the minimum size by file pattern.
 * When upload file in specified pattern is larger than the above minimum, a confirmation dialog will be shown.
 ** For example, zip:5M is specified. It means, when uploading a zip larger than 5M, will show confirmation dialog. It will let the user to have a chance to confirm before uploading. However, if it is larger than the Attachment Maximum Size(deafult : 100M), it is not allowed to upload.

fields.description:
I believe that suggested below functionality is very essential for professional documentation tool.

 

I am suggesting to create a [wikipedia-like|[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Footnotes#WP:NAMEDREFS]] named references functionality on the confluence server.

 

*Namely:*

*1)* It shall be possible to create / define a list of named references to different sources

*2)* These references shall also include URL to the source (not only name and description)

E.g. equivalent wikipedia-style markup would be like that
{code:java}
<ref name="AtlassianConfluencePage">
{{cite web
| title=Atlassian Confluence page
| url=https://confluence.atlassian.com/
}}</ref>
{code}
 

*3)* It shall be possible then to refer to these named references from the text body  (also outside of the page, which contains list of references)

e.g. equivalent wikipedia-like language would be
{code:java}
<ref name="AtlassianConfluencePage" />
{code}
*4)* In the body of the page link to reference shall appear as a number in square brackets (standard wikipedia-style)

*5)* When mouse hovers over the reference in the body of the page a popup reference tooltip shall appear, showing the clickable URL to the source. In another words it shall be possible to click on the URL, pointing to the reference source directly from the body of the page, without the need to first go to the page, which contains list of references.

*6)* It shall be possible to update URLs of references without having to update each individual page

E.g. if link to a references was invoked from 10 places (which could be 10 pages, or 10 places on one page), and then reference URL has changed e.g. ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/] => [https://confluence_new.atlassian.com/),] then it would not be needed to update all places where this reference was used, but it would only be needed to update original reference:
{code:java}
<ref name="AtlassianConfluencePage"> 
{{cite web | title=Atlassian Confluence page | url=https://confluence_new.atlassian.com/ }}
</ref>
{code}
fields.summary: wikipedia-like named references functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to enable the PSD preview by adding a parameter as per [this KB article,|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf70/document-conversion-for-confluence-data-center-976757586.html] however this doesn't work for Confluence Data Center, after adding the parameter the PSD preview is not generated and an error is thrown in the logs instead
{code:java}
ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-11] [plugins.conversion.impl.FileSystemConversionState] markAsError Creating error file: /Users/confluence/Documents/conf78shared/dcl-document/211/110/360461/3047425_2.err

com.atlassian.confluence.util.sandbox.SandboxCrashedException: Sandbox has crashed while serving the request {code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 7.4.4 DC
 # Add system parameter to enable PSD preview as per [this KB article,|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf70/document-conversion-for-confluence-data-center-976757586.html]
 # Restart Confluence
 # Upload PSD to a page
 # No preview is generated

h3. Expected Results

A preview should be generated for the PSD file
h3. Actual Results

No preview is generated for the PSD file and an error is thrown
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.util.sandbox.SandboxCrashedException: Sandbox has crashed while serving the request 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The only workaround that makes the PSD preview work in Confluence at this moment:
 # Disable the sandbox in Confluence DC. This option is *not recommended*.
 Steps to disable it:
 ## Shutdown Confluence node(s)
 ## On each node, edit the setenv.sh (Linux), setenv.bat (Windows) or the service properties and add the following line in the *CATALINA_OPTS* properties:
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Ddocument.conversion.sandbox.disable=true -Dconfluence.document.conversion.imaging.enabled.psd=true ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}
# Save the file and restart Confluence nodes.
fields.summary: Not possible to preview PSD files in Confluence Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From JSD (help center for customer or project page for agents), when searching for exact match (using quotes) knowledge base articles with special words like 'in', 'this', 'is', etc. the search will return no results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD instance with an application link to the confluence server.
 # Create a space on the confluence instance with some articles that include the mentioned special words in the page content. For instance:
{panel}
Maybe *this is* a valid test
{panel}

 # Link the JSD project to the KB space.
 # Search on the help center as a customer or on the project page as an agent and observe that no results are returned for matching searches *in some cases*.

*Note*
 * This was tested with JSD 4.8.0 and Confluence 7.4.0.
 * These special words are not necessarily [CQL keywords|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/cql-keywords-reference/].
 * 
h4. (!) This is not a Jira Service Desk bug but a Confluence bug. The search for articles has the same symptoms in Confluence, also tested with Conf 7.10.2.

h3. Expected Results

The matching article should be displayed in the search results.
h3. Actual Results

Here are some examples of what I inserted in the search field and the results of the search in JSD:
 * Maybe *this is* a valid test --> returns the article
 !Screenshot 2020-10-19 at 11.48.14.png|width=213,height=142!
 * "Maybe *this is* a valid test" --> doesn't return the article
 !Screenshot 2020-10-19 at 11.23.14.png|width=210,height=140!
 * "Maybe *this is*" --> returns the article
 !Screenshot 2020-10-19 at 11.26.12.png|width=181,height=121!
 * "*this is* a valid test" --> returns the article
 !Screenshot 2020-10-19 at 11.23.27.png|width=182,height=136! 
 P.S: "this" and "is" appear to be special words and the issue only happens if these words are in the middle of the search sentence as shown in the examples.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence Cloud, there is a feature to archive individual pages, this feature isn't available on Confluence Server, so when a Cloud site is exported to XML backup then imported on server, the archived pages are not visible in page tree nor in the search results.

The only way to access those archived pages is by looking in the DB records to identify the contentid, then use "<base_url>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<contentid_here>" link.

The content_status of those pages is "archived" in the content table in the DB.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Archive individual page in Cloud instance
 # Export site from Cloud instance to XML
 # Restore the site XML backup into a Server instance
 # try to locate the archived page, it is not visible in page tree nor search results

h3. Expected Results

There should be a way to access archived pages from the page tree on Confluence Server
h3. Actual Results

The archived pages are not accessible from page tree nor in search results.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

Query the {{CONTENT}} table in the database to find the archived page. An example query if you know the exact title of the page would be:


{code:java}
select * from content where content_status = 'archived' and title = '...' and prevver is null;{code}

Use the {{CONTENTID}} retrieved from the query above to build a URL to the page {{<base_url>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<contentid_here>}}
fields.summary: Archived Pages imported from Cloud XML Site backup are not visible on Confluence Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence Data Center makes use of Hazelcast as the cluster and [distributed cache framework|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/confluence-caching-architecture/].
Hazelcast comes with its own data collection analytics (_Phone Home_) enabled by default to learn about usage of Hazelcast IMDG.

As a Confluence administrator, I would like this feature is disabled by default and I would choose to _opt-in_ in case I agree sending data from my environment to Hazelcast developer.

More information about it can be found in [Hazelcast documentation|https://docs.hazelcast.org/docs/3.12/manual/pdf/index.pdf].

h3. Suggested Solution
Make Hazelcast's Phone Home feature disabled by default in Confluence Data Center.
 
h3. Workaround 
Add the following JVM property and restart the Confluence nodes.
{code}
-Dhazelcast.phone.home.enabled=false
{code}
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like Hazelcast's Phone Home feature to be disabled by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the PDF macro to preview scanned PDF files on Confluence, the macro loads a blank page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach  [^About Confluence-1.pdf]  to a confluence page;
# Insert a PDF macro and load the PDF file;

h3. Expected Results
The macro will load the PDF preview.

h3. Actual Results
The macro will show a blank page and nothing more.

h3. Workaround
h4. Use the attachment without preview
When you attach the PDF to the page you have the option to change the size of the attachment on the page. You can choose to show it in the biggest size available, which is closer to the size of the preview.
h4. Convert the PDF to text
You can choose this one if you still would like to use the preview macro:
# Open the PDF file on Word;
# Word will convert the images to text;
# Save as PDF;
# Attach to the page and use it with the View PDF macro.

h4. Notes
The conversion to text was tested with Word 365.
fields.summary: PDF macro is rendered with blank page when used with scanned PDFs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

View File macro for Office files (tested with .doc and .xlsx) loading indefinitely when attachment is on different page

 !oc11.3.2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install or upgrade Confluence to version 7.10.x
 # Create a page and attach .doc and .xlsx to that page
 # Create a different page with [View File macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html] and attempt to display the Office attachments from that first page with the view file macro.
!diff_page.png|thumbnail!
 # Load that page

h3. Expected Results

View File Macro load Office files correctly.

h3. Actual Results

[View File macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html] for Office files (tested with .doc) loading indefinitely.

h3. Workaround 1
 * Attach the file directly into the page using the Confluence [file previewer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html] to generate the thumbnail.

h3. Workaround 2

fields.description:
Sometimes, page attachments are displayed on a Confluence page as a broken image.  This can mean that the attachment is either:
* Missing or corrupt within the Attachments folder or
* Are stored in a location on the file system that's different from what Confluence is expecting based on the file's metadata stored within the CONTENT table.

It would be proactive to have a way to determine if attachments are missing or corrupt or not residing on an expected file path and then contain the results as part of the healthcheck.  For the latter condition, users could then follow the steps outlined in [How to resolve missing attachments in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-resolve-missing-attachments-in-confluence-201761.html].
fields.summary: Page attachment validator

h3. Issue Summary
When using the Excel macro to reference an attachment (Office file) that is not on the same page, the macro will just get stuck in loading state when trying to view the file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with an Excel document attached:
|!image-2021-01-12-17-55-19-030.png|thumbnail!|
# Create a second page and add the Excel macro pointing to the Excel document on the first page:
|!image-2021-01-12-17-56-11-060.png|thumbnail!|
# Open the second page:
|!image-2021-01-12-17-56-43-983.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Expected Results
The Excel macro loads fine.
h3. Actual Results
Macro just stays stuck in loading state.

h3. Workaround
h5. Workaround 1
If you want to reference an Excel file with the macro from a different page, add an [Excerpt macro in the source page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/excerpt-macro-148062.html] and then reference it on the other page with an [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/excerpt-include-macro-148067.html] of the desired page. The macro will load.
h5. Workaround 2
Add the Excel file as an attachment to both pages.

fields.description:
I'm building a documentation space for internal use at my organization. By default, only Confluence admins can change page restrictions, but that gets tedious when several system administrators are making pages that need different restrictions for their teams. When I give a user the ability to change restrictions, they can change restrictions on all pages. There is no middle ground for restriction settings.

What would help is the ability to permit page creators to change restrictions on pages they create and child pages under those pages. These user-imposed restrictions could be overridden by a space admin as need be. The ability for a user to change restrictions on pages they've created could be added/removed by a space admin via permissions, and it might even be controlled on a page-by-page basis if needed. The default permission would be what it is currently: users lacking permissions to change restrictions. Like the "Delete Own" permission, it could be the "Restrict Own" permission.

I'm not sure what the perfect implementation would look like, but these are the thoughts I have.
fields.summary: Fine User control over Page Restrictions

fields.description:
I often use a Jira filter to create tables on Confluence, and would like to personalize the display options. I would like to be able to easily modify the order of "Columns to display" under "Display options". If I want to change which column is shown first, the only way I've found to do this is to delete the other columns then add them back in the order I want them displayed. This is not user friendly if there are many columns or I simply want to change the order of the columns. A "drag and drop" feature to change the order of the "Columns to display" would be excellent.

Example shown here where I wrote up the issue in the Atlassian Community forums:

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/How-to-easily-change-the-quot-Display-Options-quot-order-in-a/qaq-p/1572030?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=topic
fields.summary: "Drag and drop" to change order of "Columns to display" in Jira filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Page properties reports don't display the expected results if the table isn't formatted with the header row exactly at the top of the table. Testing on Confluence 7.6.2, this does work, but subsequent versions no longer support this. 
h3. Environment

7.7.4, 7.8.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page named *Test Page Properties*
 # Add the label *tester* to the page
 # Add a page property report macro to the page
 # Add a table with 3 rows inside the macro, specifying the header on the 2nd row. Should like the image below:
|h2. +*Report Title:*+ |
||Test||Test Space||
|1|Test|

 
 # Create a page named *Test Page Properties Reports*
 # Add a page property report macro to the page

 ## Set the label to *tester*
 ## **Leave the *In Space* settings as is

h3. Expected Results

_Page properties report displays the values from row beneath the header row._
h3. Actual Results

_The values in the Page Properties report are returned either empty or with the formatting set to vertical instead of horizontal._ 
h3. Workaround

1. Remove the row above the header row from the table containing the page properties. Removing this results in the page properties report displaying the data as expected.
2. Enable "masterdetail.legacy.parse" dark feature in Confluence. This will result in slower report generation and a hard limit of 1000 rows in the report.

h3. Notes

This issue appears to have been introduced in versions after Confluence 7.6.2. The reports work as expected even with the table headers in this version of Confluence.
fields.summary: Page Properties with Horizontal formatting only works if header row at the top of table

fields.description:
When opening an existing page, certain benign operations mark the editor as having unpublished changes. Of note, this will also cause the diff shown in the "View changes" menu item to be empty (no blue/green/red highlighted text)

Steps to reproduce
 # Edit an existing page
 # Focus the editor and do one of the things from the list below
 # Click "Close"

Expected:
 * No unpublished changes lozenge on View Page

Actual:
 * Unpublished changes lozenge on View Page

Known list of editor actions that trigger unpublished changes:
 * Navigate cursor via keyboard arrow keys
 * Page up/down, home
 * Escape
 * Select All
 * Select text and press Copy (command+C)
 * Open Insert menu, link dialog, or attachments dialog
 * Preview

*Note*
The unpublished changes lozenge only shows to people that have entered the editor and made changes (spurious ones outlined in this ticket or real changes). Other historical contributors to the page or just page viewers will _not_ see the lozenge. If the lozenge is really bothering you, proceed to the workaround below.

*Workaround*
 * Under the ellipsis menu, click "Revert unpublished changes". _Make sure you don't accidentally revert changes you do want to keep_ by clicking _View Changes_.
fields.summary: Certain editor operations result in spurious "unpublished changes" and an empty diff

h3. Issue description

Words are clipped/broken/cut at the end of each line when opening a knowledge base article from the Service Desk customer portal (word wrapping issue).

h3. Steps to replicate

- Install Jira 8.13.0 with Service Desk 4.13.0
- Install Confluence 6.15.9
- Create an application link using Oauth 2.0 with impersonation between both applications
- Create a new space in Confluence, and create a page in this space containing a big paragraph
- Create a new Service Desk project in Jira
- Configure a knowledge bage in the project via the page *Project Settings > Knowledge base*, using the space created in Confluence
- Open the customer portal from the Service Desk project
- Search for any word that's included in the Confluence page
- Verify that the Confluence page is found, and that there is not "word wrapping" issue there:
 !Bug_PortalSearch.png|thumbnail! 
- Now, click on the link to see the whole Confluence page

h3. Expected results

The words should not be cut at the end of each line, like it's the case when integrating Jira with Confluence versions like
- 6.15.7
 !Bug_Confluence6.15.7_CannotReplicate.png|thumbnail! 
- 7.2.0
 !Bug_Confluence7.2.0_CannotReplicate.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results

The words are cut at the end of each line, and continue on the next line:
 !Bug_Confluence6.15.9_CanReplicate.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Issues was reproduced in 6.15.8, 6.15.9, but not in 6.15.7 nor 7.2.0 or any higher Confluence 7.x version.
So, it seems that:
- the bug was introduced in 6.15.8
- the bug somehow disappeared around 7.2.0, but it is not clear which exact version fixed this bug


h3. Workaround

No workaround, besides upgrading Confluence to at least 7.2.0
fields.summary: Words are clipped/broken/cut at the end of each line when opening a knowledge base article from the Service Desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Can't upload new attachment version by Companion app for large attachment sizes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to confluence administration -> Attachment Settings. Increase "Attachment Maximum Size" value to 400mb
 # Generate MS Word document which size exceeds 250mb megabytes
 # Create new Confluence page
 # Upload previously created document to the page
 # Save the page
 # Preview attachment and choose "Edit" option to edit document by companion app
 # Add any changes to the file and try to upload it back to Confluence

h3. Expected Results

New attachment version is uploaded back to the Confluence page
h3. Actual Results
 * Attachment cannot be  uploaded to the page, progress bar seems to be stuck
 *  Below exception might occur in the log file:
{noformat}
* 2020-12-22 14:26:11,968 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-33] [jwt.internal.sal.DefaultAuthenticationResultHandler] createAndSendFailure Failure during JWT authentication
-- url: /rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk | traceId: <>
com.atlassian.jwt.exception.JwtExpiredException: Expired at <date> CET 2020 and time is now <data> CET 2020 (30 seconds leeway is allowed)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I create a table and then insert JIRA Issue/Filter items into each cell. I've put my cursor in the empty cell and then insert it, and instead of populating the cell I had selected, it adds the JIRA item into the previous cell. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link between Confluence and Jira.
 # Create a project in Jira and add issues.
 # Create a page on confluence.
 # Add a table.
 # Select a cell of the table and insert a JIRA Issue/Filter macro.
 # Execute step 5 again, however, selecting a different cell.

h3. Expected Results

Since I have selected a new cell, the JIRA Issue/Filter macro must be populated on the newly selected cell.
h3. Actual Results

After selecting a new cell to populate the result, it adds the JIRA item into the previous cell and not on the new cell.
h3. Workaround

Drag and drop the Jira items to the desired cell.
fields.summary: Inserting a JIRA Issue/Filter does not respect cursor placement and adds it to the previously selected cell

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an ordered or unordered list in Confluence, with some indented items in the list
 # Save the page and copy and paste the text into a word file like Microsoft Word, or Apple Notes

 - [^Screen Recording 2020-12-17 at 10.31.57.mov]

h3. Expected Results

All items in the list appear
h3. Actual Results

List will be broken
h3. Workaround

Clear list section and paste again

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
View File macro for Office files (tested with .xlsx) loading indefinitely:
* !vfloading.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install or upgrade Confluence to version 7.9.x
# Follow the steps to [Enable *Edit in Office* as a dark feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-edit-in-office-as-a-dark-feature-in-confluence-978217013.html].

h3. Expected Results
View File Macro load Office files correctly.

h3. Actual Results
[View File macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html] for Office files (tested with .xlsx) loading indefinitely.

h3. Workaround 1
# Remove *enable.legacy.edit.in.office* from Confluence dark feature:
#* <confluence-url>/admin/darkfeatures.action
# Use [Companion Apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/install-atlassian-companion-992678880.html] to edit files.

h3. Workaround 2
* Attach the file directly into the page using the Confluence [file previewer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html] to generate the thumbnail.

h3. Workaround 3
This requires downgrading the Office Connector plugin which may not be compatible with newer versions of Confluence and is not supported. However, this has been tested and it works with up to Confluence 7.9.3 so far:
# *Stop Confluence*
# Copy/Download the  [^OfficeConnector-11.4.0.jar] from an older version of Confluence (i.e. 7.8.0)
# Place it in the *confluence_install/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/* folder.
# From the same folder, move the *OfficeConnector-11.3.2.jar* to another folder as backup.
# *Start Confluence*

(i) If using Docker a volume like such will suffice: 

{{/docker/confluence/OfficeConnector-11.2.1.jar:/opt/atlassian/confluence/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/OfficeConnector-11.3.2.jar }}

h3. Notes
View File Macro loads *PDF* files correctly.
fields.summary: Confluence View File macro failed to load with legacy Edit in Office enabled.

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Confluence Server and Data Center used versions of Spring Web that were vulnerable to [CVE-2020-5421|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-5421].

The affected versions are before version 6.13.20, from version 6.14.0 before 7.4.8, from version 7.5.0 before 7.10.0, and from version 7.11.0 before 7.11.3.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 6.13.20
 * 6.14.0 ≤ version < 7.4.8
 * 7.5.0 ≤ version < 7.10.0
 * 7.11.0 ≤ version < 7.11.3

*Fixed versions:*
 * 6.13.20
 * 7.4.8
 * 7.10.0
 * 7.11.3
fields.summary: Reflected File Download (RFD) Attack via vulnerable version of Spring Web

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Advanced Roadmaps for Jira has  a [Shared Teams|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-shared-teams-974360272.html] feature.
This feature comes with a Custom Field named *Team* that is used to associate private and shared teams to an issue.
When a plan has a _shared team_ associated with it, a Jira Issues Macro with the Team custom field will fail to render issues with the message below if the user loading the page doesn't have the _Advanced Roadmaps shared team management_ permission in Jira.
{code}
Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error.
View these issues in Jira
{code}
 !ScreenshotError.png|thumbnail! 

\\
Listing the same issues in Jira, with the same display columns, won't fail for the affected user.

h3. Environment
Reproduced locally with:
* Jira Portfolio issue addon version *3.18.0* and latest version *3.29.2*
* Confluence version *7.4.3*
* Jira Project Management Software *7.13.11*
* Jira used for user management for the Confluence site

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(Recording attached)
h4. On the Jira and Jira Portfolio side
* Create a new group *jira-users* on the jira side and configure Jira Portfolio permissions as per the screenshot attached
* Create a new non admin user *testuser* part of the *jira-users* group
* Create a new *plan*, a new *shared team* in Jira Portfolio associated with a *Test* project and board.
* Add the *Team* field to be part of the default screens for display and new issue creation for the *Test* project 
* Create a few issues in the *Test* project and associate them with the *Share Team* from Portfolio
* Confirm you can see the Team against the issues whilst log in with *testuser*

h4. On the Confluence side
* Create a new Page that contains 2 Jira Issues Macro:
** one that displays default information from JQL: *Project = Test*
** The second one that displays the *Team* column in addition to the default one but still querying the Test project: *Project = Test*

h3. Expected Results
*testuser* should be able to see the Jira issues from Confluence JIM as it is able to see the Jira issues directly in Jira.


h3. Actual Results
*testuser* cannot see Jira Issue Macro in Confluence when it contains Team information. It will however be able to see the first Jira Issue Macro fine.

fields.description:
h3. Problem
At the moment the Widget Connector Macro doesn't support integration with media content from ClipBucket

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the support of Clipbucket source for the Widget Connector Macro

h3. Why This Is Important
Clipbucket is more and more used in Enterprise for multimedia content

h3. Workaround
None at this stage
fields.summary: Support of Clipbucket for the Widget Connector Macro
